oai_dc:dc.dc:title: St. Mark AME Parsons: The History of Decatur County
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Younger, Lillye
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: St. Mark African Methodist Episcopal Church, Parsons
County History for Decatur County, entitled "The History of Decatur County: Past and Present."

The St. Mark African Methodist Episcopal Church has its origin in 1908. The church, located in the community of Two-Foot in Parsons, met in a frame building until 1965. At the time, the small congregation of sixty-sight constructed a new brick building for $10,000. Built by D.R. Price Construction Company of Parsons, the current building was financed on a "pay as you go" basis and partially through bake sale profits. On November 24, 1965, the Parsons Masonic Lodge No. 47 laid the cornerstone for the church.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Church history
